segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 14. Yodhājīvavagga
segments.en: 14. A Warrior

segments.pli: 141. Assaparassasutta
segments.en: 141. Excellent Horses

segments.pli: “Tayo ca, bhikkhave, assaparasse desessāmi tayo ca purisaparasse.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you the three excellent horses and the three excellent people.

segments.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” they replied.

segments.pli: Bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “Katame ca, bhikkhave, tayo assaparassā?
segments.en: “What are the three excellent horses?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assaparasso javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
segments.en: One excellent horse is quick, but not beautiful or well proportioned.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assaparasso javasampanno hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
segments.en: Another excellent horse is quick and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assaparasso javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
segments.en: While another excellent horse is quick, beautiful, and well proportioned.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo assaparassā.
segments.en: These are the three excellent horses.

segments.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, tayo purisaparassā?
segments.en: “What are the three excellent people?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco purisaparasso javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
segments.en: One excellent person is quick, but not beautiful or well proportioned.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco purisaparasso javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
segments.en: Another excellent person is quick and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco purisaparasso javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
segments.en: While another excellent person is quick, beautiful, and well proportioned.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisaparasso javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno?
segments.en: And how is an excellent person quick, but not beautiful or well proportioned?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant, with the ending of the five lower fetters, is reborn spontaneously. They’re extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.

segments.pli: Idamassa javasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re quick, I say.

segments.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho saṃsādeti, no vissajjeti.
segments.en: But when asked a question about the teaching or training, they falter without answering.

segments.pli: Idamassa na vaṇṇasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re not beautiful, I say.

segments.pli: Na kho pana lābhī hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
segments.en: And they don’t receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: Idamassa na ārohapariṇāhasmiṃ vadāmi. Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, purisaparasso javasampanno hoti;
segments.en: This is how they’re not well proportioned, I say. This is how an excellent person is quick,

segments.pli: na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
segments.en: but not beautiful or well proportioned.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisaparasso javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno?
segments.en: And how is an excellent person quick and beautiful, but not well proportioned?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant, with the ending of the five lower fetters, is reborn spontaneously. They’re extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.

segments.pli: Idamassa javasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re quick, I say.

segments.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeti, no saṃsādeti.
segments.en: When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering.

segments.pli: Idamassa vaṇṇasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re beautiful, I say.

segments.pli: Na kho pana lābhī hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
segments.en: But they don’t receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: Idamassa na ārohapariṇāhasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re not well proportioned, I say.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, purisaparasso javasampanno ca hoti; vaṇṇasampanno ca, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
segments.en: This is how an excellent person quick, and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisaparasso javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca?
segments.en: And how is an excellent person quick, beautiful, and well proportioned?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant, with the ending of the five lower fetters, is reborn spontaneously. They’re extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.

segments.pli: Idamassa javasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re quick, I say.

segments.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeti, no saṃsādeti.
segments.en: When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering.

segments.pli: Idamassa vaṇṇasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re beautiful, I say.

segments.pli: Lābhī kho pana hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
segments.en: They receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: Idamassa ārohapariṇāhasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re well proportioned, I say.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, purisaparasso javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
segments.en: This is how an excellent person is quick, beautiful, and well proportioned.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo purisaparassā”ti.
segments.en: These are the three excellent people.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Training people is like training good horses.
